title: why do new players with 50 wins have such a high mmr?
body:
It's kinda annoying me getting matched with genuinely new players going yi jungle and ending up 0/15 before 20min 


should your mmr be determined by how many normal wins you have?

300 = 1500

100 = 1300 

etc

replies.body: Maybe your MMR is just bad?

I'm pretty sure it's around 1500 which(if i'm correct) is what fresh lvl30s start with

low gold/high silver

http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=22+5+19+20+1

press "calculate my mmr"

It says:

The Average MMR for this league is 1,468.

1,402

MMR

Your MMR is lower than the average expected MMR for players in your division. Your MMR will continue to tank unless you improve your play!

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/ABRhMlx8-losing-mmr-for-winning-games

I've been duoing with a b2 friend a lot..
OP.GG doesn't count duos, only games you've played solo in ranked.

Fact: Duoing is no longer able to be tracked by OP.GG and if you read, they flat out tell you that duoing will change your MMR artifically and that is why they normally wouldn't count it.

Fact is if you duo, your MMR for OP.GG will be even more inaccurate, and not only that it's already obvious from your Game MMR's (they go from 1100 to just below 1300) that you have been duoing.

If you are duoing in the last 4-5 games OP.GG MMR calculations will be off.

> [{quoted}](name=22 5 19 20 1,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=y2rivsO9,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-09T09:30:08.160+0000)
>
> Fact: Duoing is no longer able to be tracked by OP.GG and if you read, they flat out tell you that duoing will change your MMR artifically and that is why they normally wouldn't count it.
> 
> Fact is if you duo, your MMR for OP.GG will be even more inaccurate, and not only that it's already obvious from your Game MMR's (they go from 1100 to just below 1300) that you have been duoing.
> 
> If you are duoing in the last 4-5 games OP.GG MMR calculations will be off.

Nope, they don't. They realized duo queue skewed the calculations, their system now ignores duo queued games. You just have bad MMR.
and after a few games on my own it's returned to normal...

> [{quoted}](name=22 5 19 20 1,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=y2rivsO9,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-01-09T04:19:38.509+0000)
>
> should your mmr be determined by how many normal wins you have?

For some people yes, but you have to remember the following:
- People could have come from other MOBAs and have plenty of experience with the genre, meaning it wouldn't take them long to learn the mechanics of LoL specifically (definitely achievable by level 30 with a MOBA background).
- There are people who will never improve no matter how much they practice. I'm sure the are plenty of people with thousands of wins who are still in bronze.
- This is OCE, this general skill level difference between our server and other servers is significant.

tldr Circumstantial.
